info.title: EchoVR API
info.description: This page documents the API hosted by any local EchoVR client, including Quest or PC versions of the game. Example responses and request bodies are included. If you see any errors, please submit a pull request to [GitHub](https://github.com/qlyoung/echovr.gg/).

externalDocs.description: Find out more about the EchoVR API from the unofficial documentation on GitHub

tags.name: State
tags.description: Returns information about the game state

tags.name: Camera Write
tags.description: Enables programmatic control over the spectator camera

tags.name: Join Game
tags.description: Enable users to join a match with a session id

tags.name: Private Arena Match
tags.description: All API endpoints used to control the rules of private Arena Match

200.description: Response while in a valid game state.

500.description: API is not available in the current game state.

get.summary: Returns the joint positions/orientations for each player.

200.description: Response while in a valid game state.

500.description: API is not available in the current game state.

post.summary: Shows or hides the 2D game UI.

requestBody.description: The desired UI visibility state. This can be used both as a player or as a spectator.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

post.summary: Shows or hides the 2D minimap in spectator mode.

requestBody.description: The desired minimap visibility state. This can be used both as a player or as a spectator.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

post.summary: Mutes or unmutes a specific team for a spectator.

requestBody.description: The desired muted state for each team. This can only be used in spectator mode.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

post.summary: Sets the position, orientation, and FOV of the spectator camera.

requestBody.description: The desired camera transform. If fields are not included, they will default to 0 for the positions, the identity quaternion for the orientation, and 0 for the fov, so it is advised to include all fields. This can only be used in spectator mode.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

post.summary: Sets the mode of the spectator camera.

requestBody.description: The desired camera mode and player id. The API cannot switch away from the free cam mode (c) automatically, but it can switch into it. If only the player id and no mode is provided, the mode will be pov. The num field is the same as the playerid field in the /session API. This can only be used in spectator mode.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

post.summary: Join a private game via the session id

requestBody.description: The desired session id and the team index

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

get.summary: Get the current rules of the Arena match

200.description: Response while in a valid game state.

SampleResponseArena.value:
{
  "MINUTES":10,
  "BLUE ROUNDS WON":0,
  "SECONDS":0,
  "BLUE SCORE":0,
  "MERCY SCORE DIFF":20,
  "ORANGE SCORE":5,
  "GOAL STOPS TIME":false,
  "ROUND WAIT TIME":59,
  "CARRY POINTS OVER":false,
  "DISC LOCATION":1,
  "ROUNDS PLAYED":1,
  "CATAPULT TIME":12,
  "RESPAWN TIME":3,
  "ROUND COUNT":3,
  "SELF-GOALING":true,
  "TEAM ONLY VOICE":true,
  "ORANGE ROUNDS WON":0,
  "OVERTIME":0,
  "STANDARD CHASSIS":false,
  "MERCY ENABLED":true,
  "DISC CURVE":false,
  "GOALIE PING ADV":false,
  "err_code":0
}

post.summary: Set the rules of a Private Arena matches

requestBody.description: The desired rules and the values you want to set

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

post.summary: Set the selected team as ready

requestBody.description: The desired team index of the team you want to ready up

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid. If the player is in the game as a player, the team_idx must correspond to the team the user is currently in. Spectator can trigger it for both team.

post.summary: Trigger a pause request for the selected team

requestBody.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid. If the player is in the game as a player, the team_idx must correspond to the team the user is currently in. Spectator can trigger it for both team.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid. If the player is in the game as a player, the team_idx must correspond to the team the user is currently in. Spectator can trigger it for both team.

post.summary: Trigger a restart request for the selected team

requestBody.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid. If the player is in the game as a player, the team_idx must correspond to the team the user is currently in. Spectator can trigger it for both team.

200.description: Any processed response while in a valid API state. The request body does not have to be valid.

num.description: The id of the player to follow. This is playerid in the /session api.

qx.description: X component of the orientation quaternion

qy.description: Y component of the orientation quaternion

qz.description: Z component of the orientation quaternion

qw.description: W component of the orientation quaternion

fovy.description: FOV of the camera. 0 is fully zoomed in, and 1.6 is the maximum FOV, which is around 90 degrees.

team_idx.description: 0 for Blue team, 1 for Orange team and 2 for Spectator

DISC LOCATION.description: 0 for Blue team, 1 for middle of the Arena and 2 for Orange team

team_idx.description: 0 for Blue team, 1 for Orange team and 2 for Spectator
